com.xhive.index.interfaces
Interface XhiveIndexIf

All Superinterfaces:
XhiveLockingContextIf, XhiveNamedItemIf
All Known Subinterfaces:
XhiveCCIndexIf
public interface XhiveIndexIf
extends XhiveNamedItemIf, XhiveLockingContextIf

An XhiveIndexIf index stores key-value pairs, of wich the key is an object like a string, integer, etcetera, and the value is a node set. Indexes enable the rapid retrieval of nodes.

An index is created using one of the add index functions of XhiveIndexListIf.

Index properties
KEY_SORTED By default, all indexes do not keep their keys sorted. The update performance of indexes without sorted keys may be better than the performance of indexes with sorted keys.

Live behaviour
All indextypes, except the node filter index, have live behaviour. Live indexes are updated automatically when data is updated.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0
See Also:
more info about indexes.

Field Detail

NO_OPTIONS

static final int NO_OPTIONS
Index property. The index has default properties.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

KEY_SORTED

static final int KEY_SORTED
Index property. The index maintains its keys sorted. Full text indexes are always key sorted.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
for more information about sorting of index keys, Constant Field Values

UNIQUE_KEYS

static final int UNIQUE_KEYS
Index property. The keys in this index must be unique. Not applicable to node filter indexes. Not implemented for concurrent indexes.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

CONCURRENT

static final int CONCURRENT
Index property. The index is a concurrent index. Concurrent indexes are not locked and can be used by more transactions simultaneously. Depending on the application, concurrent indexes can be more expensive to use than non-concurrent indexes. Concurrent indexes do not have their own permissions, they use the permissions of the owning library child. Not applicable to node filter indexes.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_MASK

static final int TYPE_MASK
Mask to retrieve the index type. Cannot be used as an option. This can be used to find the index type by comparing (getOptions() & XhiveIndexIf.TYPE_MASK) with TYPE_STRING etc.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_STRING

static final int TYPE_STRING
Index property. Only applicable to value indexes. The index will be created as a string index. This means that the keys (if ordered) are ordered by their string value. Keys returned by this index are of type String. A string index can be used for XQuery queries that compare nodes to strings as in //elem[@attr = "foo"]

String is the default index type, if you specify no type, a string index will be created.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_INT

static final int TYPE_INT
Index property. Only applicable to value indexes. The index will be created as an int index. All values in the indexed element or attribute should be parsable by Integer.parseInt(java.lang.String). The keys (if ordered) are ordered by their int value. Keys returned by this index are of type Integer. An int index can be used for XQuery queries that compare nodes to integers as in //elem[@attr = 10]

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_LONG

static final int TYPE_LONG
Index property. Only applicable to value indexes. The index will be created as a long index. All values in the indexed element or attribute should be parsable by Long.parseLong(java.lang.String). The keys (if ordered) are ordered by their long value. Keys returned by this index are of type Long. A long index can be used for XQuery queries that compare nodes to integers as in //elem[@attr = 10]

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_FLOAT

static final int TYPE_FLOAT
Index property. Only applicable to value indexes. The index will be created as a float index. All values in the indexed element or attribute should be parsable by Float.parseFloat(java.lang.String). The keys (if ordered) are ordered by their float value. Keys returned by this index are of type Float. A float index can be used for XQuery queries that compare nodes to floats as in //elem[@attr = float("1.3e4")]

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_DOUBLE

static final int TYPE_DOUBLE
Index property. Only applicable to value indexes. The index will be created as a double index. All values in the indexed element or attribute should be parsable by Double.parseDouble(java.lang.String). The keys (if ordered) are ordered by their double value. Keys returned by this index are of type Double. A double index can be used for XQuery queries that compare nodes to doubles as in //elem[@attr = 1.3e4]

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

TYPE_DATE_TIME

static final int TYPE_DATE_TIME
DateTime and Duration index types. Only applicable to value indexes. The index will be created as a string index. All values in the indexed element or attribute should be parsable as dictated by the XML schema specs. The keys (if ordered) are ordered by their value. Keys returned by this index are of type java.lang.String.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1
See Also:

Constant Field Values

FTI_GET_ALL_TEXT

static final int FTI_GET_ALL_TEXT

Index property. If set then it's allowed for indexed nodes to have children. The complete text below the indexed element will be indexed as a single text value, including the textnodes below child nodes of the index. Additional whitespace is added between the the values of two separate text nodes when creating the single text value for the element.

WARNING: Setting this option will have a significant influence on update performance!

This option is only applicable to indexes of type full text

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

FTI_INCLUDE_ATTRIBUTES

static final int FTI_INCLUDE_ATTRIBUTES
Index property for full text indexes. If this is set on a full text index for element values, the text of attributes of the indexed element (or elements, if FTI_GET_ALL_TEXT is set) will be indexed as well. Because the attribute contents are not part of the element value according to the XQuery specification, such an index will not be used by XQuery.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

FTI_SUPPORT_PHRASES

static final int FTI_SUPPORT_PHRASES
Index property. If set the index will keep extra information about the position of terms within a node. This information can be used by the full text search code to optimize phrase searches. Phrase searches are searches more than one terms that occur consecutive or within a certain distance of eachother.

This option is only applicable to indexes of type full text

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

FTI_SA_ADJUST_TO_LOWERCASE

static final int FTI_SA_ADJUST_TO_LOWERCASE

If the standard analyzer is used, and this option is set all terms are adjusted to lowercase. This makes full text searches using this index case insensitive.

This option is only applicable to indexes of type full text

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

FTI_SA_FILTER_ENGLISH_STOP_WORDS

static final int FTI_SA_FILTER_ENGLISH_STOP_WORDS

If the standard analyzer is used, and this option is set than stopword terms are not inserted into the index. The list of stopwords is: "a", "and", "are", "as", "at", "be", "but", "by", "for", "if", "in", "into", "is", "it", "no", "not", "of", "on", "or", "s", "such", "t", "that", "the", "their", "then", "there", "these", "they", "this", "to", "was", "will", "with"

This option is only applicable to indexes of type full text

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

Method Detail

getType

int getType()
Get the type of the index

Returns:
type, one of the values NODE_FILTER_INDEX, LIBRARY_ID_INDEX, LIBRARY_NAME_INDEX, ID_ATTRIBUTE_INDEX, SELECTED_ELEMENT_NAMES_INDEX, FULL_TEXT_INDEX, VALUE_INDEX
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0

getKeys

XhiveIndexKeyIteratorIf getKeys()
Gets an iterator for iterating over the keys in this index. The iterator becomes invalid after a commit, checkpoint or abort.

Returns:
The Iterator containing all keys. The keys are always strings so the objects returned by the iterator need to be cast to a String. If the index was created with the sortKeys flag set to true, the keys are returned in alphabetic order.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

getKeysFrom

XhiveIndexKeyIteratorIf getKeysFrom(java.lang.Object key)
Gets an iterator for iterating over the keys in this index. The iterator starts with the given key. If this key is not contained by the index, the iterator starts with the key first following the given key. The iterator becomes invalid after a commit, checkpoint or abort. This function only applies to indexes with sorted keys.

Parameters:
key - the first key returned by the Iterator.next() function
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

getKeysDescending

XhiveIndexKeyIteratorIf getKeysDescending()
Gets an iterator for iterating over the keys in this index in reverse order. The iterator becomes invalid after a commit, checkpoint or abort.

Returns:
The Iterator containing all keys. The keys are always strings so the objects returned by the iterator need to be cast to a String. If the index was created with the sortKeys flag set to true, the keys are returned in descending alphabetic order.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getKeysDescendingFrom

XhiveIndexKeyIteratorIf getKeysDescendingFrom(java.lang.Object key)
Gets an iterator for iterating over the keys in this index in reverse order. The iterator starts with the given key. If this key is not contained by the index, the iterator starts with the key first preceding the given key. The iterator becomes invalid after a commit, checkpoint or abort. This function only applies to indexes with sorted keys.

Parameters:
key - the first key returned by the Iterator.next() function
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

getNodesByKey

XhiveNodeIteratorIf getNodesByKey(java.lang.Object key)
Get an iterator containing all nodes that are associated with the given key. The iterator becomes invalid after a commit, checkpoint or abort.

Parameters:
key - the key to retrieve nodes for.
Returns:
The iterator containing all nodes that are associated with the given key. If the key is not found in the index, this method returns null. When there are no other nodes left and next is called, the iterator will throw a NoSuchElementException.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

getNodeByKey

Node getNodeByKey(java.lang.Object key)
Retrieve a single node for a given key. This is a convenience version of getNodesByKey(java.lang.Object) if you know that you need to retrieve only a single node.

Returns:
The node associated with the given key. If there are more nodes for the given key, this method returns only the first one.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

getOptions

int getOptions()
Get the options mask

Returns:
the options mask
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

isKeySorted

boolean isKeySorted()
Check if the keys for this index are sorted

Returns:
true if the keys are sorted
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
